info.title: KeyVaultClient
info.description: The key vault client performs cryptographic key operations and vault operations against the Key Vault service.

get.summary: List certificates in a specified key vault
get.description: The GetCertificates operation returns the set of certificates resources in the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

parameters.name: includePending
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include certificates which are not completely provisioned.

200.description: A response message containing a list of certificates along with a link to the next page of certificates.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists the certificate contacts for a specified key vault.
get.description: The GetCertificateContacts operation returns the set of certificate contact resources in the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/managecontacts permission.

200.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.summary: Sets the certificate contacts for the specified key vault.
put.description: Sets the certificate contacts for the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/managecontacts permission.

requestBody.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

200.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Deletes the certificate contacts for a specified key vault.
delete.description: Deletes the certificate contacts for a specified key vault certificate. This operation requires the certificates/managecontacts permission.

200.description: The contacts for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: List certificate issuers for a specified key vault.
get.description: The GetCertificateIssuers operation returns the set of certificate issuer resources in the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/manageissuers/getissuers permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of certificate issuers in a key vault along with a link to the next page of certificate issuers.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists the specified certificate issuer.
get.description: The GetCertificateIssuer operation returns the specified certificate issuer resources in the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/manageissuers/getissuers permission.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: The SetCertificateIssuer operation adds or updates the specified certificate issuer. This operation requires the certificates/setissuers permission.

requestBody.description: Certificate issuer set parameter.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: The DeleteCertificateIssuer operation permanently removes the specified certificate issuer from the vault. This operation requires the certificates/manageissuers/deleteissuers permission.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: The UpdateCertificateIssuer operation performs an update on the specified certificate issuer entity. This operation requires the certificates/setissuers permission.

requestBody.description: Certificate issuer update parameter.

200.description: The issuer for the key vault certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Restores a backed up certificate to a vault.
post.description: Restores a backed up certificate, and all its versions, to a vault. This operation requires the certificates/restore permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to restore the certificate.

200.description: Restored certificate bundle in the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Deletes a certificate from a specified key vault.
delete.description: Deletes all versions of a certificate object along with its associated policy. Delete certificate cannot be used to remove individual versions of a certificate object. This operation requires the certificates/delete permission.

200.description: The deleted certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Backs up the specified certificate.
post.description: Requests that a backup of the specified certificate be downloaded to the client. All versions of the certificate will be downloaded. This operation requires the certificates/backup permission.

200.description: The backup blob containing the backed up certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Creates a new certificate.
post.description: If this is the first version, the certificate resource is created. This operation requires the certificates/create permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to create a certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Imports a certificate into a specified key vault.
post.description: Imports an existing valid certificate, containing a private key, into Azure Key Vault. The certificate to be imported can be in either PFX or PEM format. If the certificate is in PEM format the PEM file must contain the key as well as x509 certificates. This operation requires the certificates/import permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to import the certificate.

200.description: Imported certificate bundle to the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the creation operation of a certificate.
get.description: Gets the creation operation associated with a specified certificate. This operation requires the certificates/get permission.

200.description: The certificate operation response.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Deletes the creation operation for a specific certificate.
delete.description: Deletes the creation operation for a specified certificate that is in the process of being created. The certificate is no longer created. This operation requires the certificates/update permission.

200.description: A message containing the certificate operation response.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates a certificate creation operation that is already in progress. This operation requires the certificates/update permission.

requestBody.description: The certificate operation response.

200.description: A message containing the certificate operation response.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Merges a certificate or a certificate chain with a key pair existing on the server.
post.description: The MergeCertificate operation performs the merging of a certificate or certificate chain with a key pair currently available in the service. This operation requires the certificates/create permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to merge certificate.

201.description: Merged certificate bundle to the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists the policy for a certificate.
get.description: The GetCertificatePolicy operation returns the specified certificate policy resources in the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/get permission.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in a given key vault.

200.description: The certificate policy.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.summary: Updates the policy for a certificate.
patch.description: Set specified members in the certificate policy. Leave others as null. This operation requires the certificates/update permission.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in the given vault.

requestBody.description: The policy for the certificate.

200.description: The certificate policy

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: List the versions of a certificate.
get.description: The GetCertificateVersions operation returns the versions of a certificate in the specified key vault. This operation requires the certificates/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of certificates in the key vault along with a link to the next page of keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets information about a certificate.
get.description: Gets information about a specific certificate. This operation requires the certificates/get permission.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in the given vault.

200.description: The retrieved certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.summary: Updates the specified attributes associated with the given certificate.
patch.description: The UpdateCertificate operation applies the specified update on the given certificate; the only elements updated are the certificate's attributes. This operation requires the certificates/update permission.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the certificate in the given key vault.

requestBody.description: The parameters for certificate update.

200.description: The updated certificate.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists the deleted certificates in the specified vault currently available for recovery.
get.description: The GetDeletedCertificates operation retrieves the certificates in the current vault which are in a deleted state and ready for recovery or purging. This operation includes deletion-specific information. This operation requires the certificates/get/list permission. This operation can only be enabled on soft-delete enabled vaults.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

parameters.name: includePending
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include certificates which are not completely provisioned.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted certificates in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted certificates

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Retrieves information about the specified deleted certificate.
get.description: The GetDeletedCertificate operation retrieves the deleted certificate information plus its attributes, such as retention interval, scheduled permanent deletion and the current deletion recovery level. This operation requires the certificates/get permission.

200.description: A Certificate bundle of the certificate and its attributes

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Permanently deletes the specified deleted certificate.
delete.description: The PurgeDeletedCertificate operation performs an irreversible deletion of the specified certificate, without possibility for recovery. The operation is not available if the recovery level does not specify 'Purgeable'. This operation requires the certificate/purge permission.

204.description: No content signaling that the certificate was purged forever.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Recovers the deleted certificate back to its current version under /certificates.
post.description: The RecoverDeletedCertificate operation performs the reversal of the Delete operation. The operation is applicable in vaults enabled for soft-delete, and must be issued during the retention interval (available in the deleted certificate's attributes). This operation requires the certificates/recover permission.

parameters.name: certificate-name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted certificate

200.description: A Certificate bundle of the original certificate and its attributes

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists the deleted keys in the specified vault.
get.description: Retrieves a list of the keys in the Key Vault as JSON Web Key structures that contain the public part of a deleted key. This operation includes deletion-specific information. The Get Deleted Keys operation is applicable for vaults enabled for soft-delete. While the operation can be invoked on any vault, it will return an error if invoked on a non soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the keys/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted keys in the vault along with a link to the next page of deleted keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the public part of a deleted key.
get.description: The Get Deleted Key operation is applicable for soft-delete enabled vaults. While the operation can be invoked on any vault, it will return an error if invoked on a non soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the keys/get permission.

200.description: A DeletedKeyBundle consisting of a WebKey plus its Attributes and deletion information.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: The Purge Deleted Key operation is applicable for soft-delete enabled vaults. While the operation can be invoked on any vault, it will return an error if invoked on a non soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the keys/purge permission.

204.description: No content, signaling that the key was permanently purged.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Recovers the deleted key to its latest version.
post.description: The Recover Deleted Key operation is applicable for deleted keys in soft-delete enabled vaults. It recovers the deleted key back to its latest version under /keys. An attempt to recover an non-deleted key will return an error. Consider this the inverse of the delete operation on soft-delete enabled vaults. This operation requires the keys/recover permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted key.

200.description: A Key bundle of the original key and its attributes

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists deleted secrets for the specified vault.
get.description: The Get Deleted Secrets operation returns the secrets that have been deleted for a vault enabled for soft-delete. This operation requires the secrets/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted secrets in the vault, along with a link to the next page of deleted secrets.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the specified deleted secret.
get.description: The Get Deleted Secret operation returns the specified deleted secret along with its attributes. This operation requires the secrets/get permission.

200.description: A secret bundle of the secret and its attributes.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: The purge deleted secret operation removes the secret permanently, without the possibility of recovery. This operation can only be enabled on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the secrets/purge permission.

204.description: No content signaling that the secret was purged forever.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Recovers the deleted secret to the latest version.
post.description: Recovers the deleted secret in the specified vault. This operation can only be performed on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the secrets/recover permission.

parameters.name: secret-name
parameters.description: The name of the deleted secret.

200.description: A Secret bundle of the original secret and its attributes.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists deleted storage accounts for the specified vault.
get.description: The Get Deleted Storage Accounts operation returns the storage accounts that have been deleted for a vault enabled for soft-delete. This operation requires the storage/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted storage accounts in the vault, along with a link to the next page of deleted storage accounts.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the specified deleted storage account.
get.description: The Get Deleted Storage Account operation returns the specified deleted storage account along with its attributes. This operation requires the storage/get permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

200.description: The deleted storage account and information on when it will be purged, and how to recover the deleted storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Permanently deletes the specified storage account.
delete.description: The purge deleted storage account operation removes the secret permanently, without the possibility of recovery. This operation can only be performed on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the storage/purge permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

204.description: No content signaling that the storage account was purged forever.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Recovers the deleted storage account.
post.description: Recovers the deleted storage account in the specified vault. This operation can only be performed on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the storage/recover permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

200.description: A storage bundle of the original storage account and its attributes.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Lists deleted SAS definitions for the specified vault and storage account.
get.description: The Get Deleted Sas Definitions operation returns the SAS definitions that have been deleted for a vault enabled for soft-delete. This operation requires the storage/listsas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of deleted SAS definitions for the storage account, along with a link to the next page of deleted SAS definitions.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the specified deleted sas definition.
get.description: The Get Deleted SAS Definition operation returns the specified deleted SAS definition along with its attributes. This operation requires the storage/getsas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: sas-definition-name
parameters.description: The name of the SAS definition.

200.description: The deleted SAS definition and information on when the it will be purged, and how to recover the deleted SAS definition.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Recovers the deleted SAS definition.
post.description: Recovers the deleted SAS definition for the specified storage account. This operation can only be performed on a soft-delete enabled vault. This operation requires the storage/recover permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: sas-definition-name
parameters.description: The name of the SAS definition.

200.description: A SAS definition bundle of the original SAS definition and its attributes.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: List keys in the specified vault.
get.description: Retrieves a list of the keys in the Key Vault as JSON Web Key structures that contain the public part of a stored key. The LIST operation is applicable to all key types, however only the base key identifier, attributes, and tags are provided in the response. Individual versions of a key are not listed in the response. This operation requires the keys/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of keys in the vault along with a link to the next page of keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Restores a backed up key to a vault.
post.description: Imports a previously backed up key into Azure Key Vault, restoring the key, its key identifier, attributes and access control policies. The RESTORE operation may be used to import a previously backed up key. Individual versions of a key cannot be restored. The key is restored in its entirety with the same key name as it had when it was backed up. If the key name is not available in the target Key Vault, the RESTORE operation will be rejected. While the key name is retained during restore, the final key identifier will change if the key is restored to a different vault. Restore will restore all versions and preserve version identifiers. The RESTORE operation is subject to security constraints: The target Key Vault must be owned by the same Microsoft Azure Subscription as the source Key Vault The user must have RESTORE permission in the target Key Vault. This operation requires the keys/restore permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to restore the key.

200.description: Restored key bundle in the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.summary: Imports an externally created key, stores it, and returns key parameters and attributes to the client.
put.description: The import key operation may be used to import any key type into an Azure Key Vault. If the named key already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of the key. This operation requires the keys/import permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to import a key.

200.description: Imported key bundle to the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Deletes a key of any type from storage in Azure Key Vault.
delete.description: The delete key operation cannot be used to remove individual versions of a key. This operation removes the cryptographic material associated with the key, which means the key is not usable for Sign/Verify, Wrap/Unwrap or Encrypt/Decrypt operations. This operation requires the keys/delete permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of the key to delete.

200.description: The public part of the deleted key and deletion information on when the key will be purged.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Requests that a backup of the specified key be downloaded to the client.
post.description: The Key Backup operation exports a key from Azure Key Vault in a protected form. Note that this operation does NOT return key material in a form that can be used outside the Azure Key Vault system, the returned key material is either protected to a Azure Key Vault HSM or to Azure Key Vault itself. The intent of this operation is to allow a client to GENERATE a key in one Azure Key Vault instance, BACKUP the key, and then RESTORE it into another Azure Key Vault instance. The BACKUP operation may be used to export, in protected form, any key type from Azure Key Vault. Individual versions of a key cannot be backed up. BACKUP / RESTORE can be performed within geographical boundaries only; meaning that a BACKUP from one geographical area cannot be restored to another geographical area. For example, a backup from the US geographical area cannot be restored in an EU geographical area. This operation requires the key/backup permission.

200.description: The backup blob containing the backed up key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Creates a new key, stores it, then returns key parameters and attributes to the client.
post.description: The create key operation can be used to create any key type in Azure Key Vault. If the named key already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of the key. It requires the keys/create permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name for the new key. The system will generate the version name for the new key.

requestBody.description: The parameters to create a key.

200.description: A key bundle containing the result of the create key request.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of individual key versions with the same key name.
get.description: The full key identifier, attributes, and tags are provided in the response. This operation requires the keys/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of keys along with a link to the next page of keys.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Gets the public part of a stored key.
get.description: The get key operation is applicable to all key types. If the requested key is symmetric, then no key material is released in the response. This operation requires the keys/get permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of the key to get.

parameters.name: key-version
parameters.description: Adding the version parameter retrieves a specific version of a key.

200.description: A key bundle containing the key and its attributes.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.summary: The update key operation changes specified attributes of a stored key and can be applied to any key type and key version stored in Azure Key Vault.
patch.description: In order to perform this operation, the key must already exist in the Key Vault. Note: The cryptographic material of a key itself cannot be changed. This operation requires the keys/update permission.

parameters.name: key-name
parameters.description: The name of key to update.

parameters.name: key-version
parameters.description: The version of the key to update.

requestBody.description: The parameters of the key to update.

200.description: The updated key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Decrypts a single block of encrypted data.
post.description: The DECRYPT operation decrypts a well-formed block of ciphertext using the target encryption key and specified algorithm. This operation is the reverse of the ENCRYPT operation; only a single block of data may be decrypted, the size of this block is dependent on the target key and the algorithm to be used. The DECRYPT operation applies to asymmetric and symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since it uses the private portion of the key. This operation requires the keys/decrypt permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for the decryption operation.

200.description: The decryption result.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Encrypts an arbitrary sequence of bytes using an encryption key that is stored in a key vault.
post.description: The ENCRYPT operation encrypts an arbitrary sequence of bytes using an encryption key that is stored in Azure Key Vault. Note that the ENCRYPT operation only supports a single block of data, the size of which is dependent on the target key and the encryption algorithm to be used. The ENCRYPT operation is only strictly necessary for symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since protection with an asymmetric key can be performed using public portion of the key. This operation is supported for asymmetric keys as a convenience for callers that have a key-reference but do not have access to the public key material. This operation requires the keys/encrypt permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for the encryption operation.

200.description: The encryption result.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Creates a signature from a digest using the specified key.
post.description: The SIGN operation is applicable to asymmetric and symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since this operation uses the private portion of the key. This operation requires the keys/sign permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for the signing operation.

200.description: The signature value.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Unwraps a symmetric key using the specified key that was initially used for wrapping that key.
post.description: The UNWRAP operation supports decryption of a symmetric key using the target key encryption key. This operation is the reverse of the WRAP operation. The UNWRAP operation applies to asymmetric and symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since it uses the private portion of the key. This operation requires the keys/unwrapKey permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for the key operation.

200.description: The unwrapped symmetric key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Verifies a signature using a specified key.
post.description: The VERIFY operation is applicable to symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault. VERIFY is not strictly necessary for asymmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since signature verification can be performed using the public portion of the key but this operation is supported as a convenience for callers that only have a key-reference and not the public portion of the key. This operation requires the keys/verify permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for verify operations.

200.description: The verification result.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Wraps a symmetric key using a specified key.
post.description: The WRAP operation supports encryption of a symmetric key using a key encryption key that has previously been stored in an Azure Key Vault. The WRAP operation is only strictly necessary for symmetric keys stored in Azure Key Vault since protection with an asymmetric key can be performed using the public portion of the key. This operation is supported for asymmetric keys as a convenience for callers that have a key-reference but do not have access to the public key material. This operation requires the keys/wrapKey permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for wrap operation.

200.description: The wrapped symmetric key.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: List secrets in a specified key vault.
get.description: The Get Secrets operation is applicable to the entire vault. However, only the base secret identifier and its attributes are provided in the response. Individual secret versions are not listed in the response. This operation requires the secrets/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified, the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of secrets in the vault along with a link to the next page of secrets.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Restores a backed up secret to a vault.
post.description: Restores a backed up secret, and all its versions, to a vault. This operation requires the secrets/restore permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to restore the secret.

200.description: Restored secret bundle in the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.summary: Sets a secret in a specified key vault.
put.description: The SET operation adds a secret to the Azure Key Vault. If the named secret already exists, Azure Key Vault creates a new version of that secret. This operation requires the secrets/set permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for setting the secret.

200.description: A secret bundle containing the result of the set secret request.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.summary: Deletes a secret from a specified key vault.
delete.description: The DELETE operation applies to any secret stored in Azure Key Vault. DELETE cannot be applied to an individual version of a secret. This operation requires the secrets/delete permission.

200.description: The deleted secret and information on when the secret will be deleted, and how to recover the deleted secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Backs up the specified secret.
post.description: Requests that a backup of the specified secret be downloaded to the client. All versions of the secret will be downloaded. This operation requires the secrets/backup permission.

200.description: The backup blob containing the backed up secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: List all versions of the specified secret.
get.description: The full secret identifier and attributes are provided in the response. No values are returned for the secrets. This operations requires the secrets/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified, the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of secrets along with a link to the next page of secrets.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.summary: Get a specified secret from a given key vault.
get.description: The GET operation is applicable to any secret stored in Azure Key Vault. This operation requires the secrets/get permission.

200.description: The retrieved secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.summary: Updates the attributes associated with a specified secret in a given key vault.
patch.description: The UPDATE operation changes specified attributes of an existing stored secret. Attributes that are not specified in the request are left unchanged. The value of a secret itself cannot be changed. This operation requires the secrets/set permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters for update secret operation.

200.description: The updated secret.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List storage accounts managed by the specified key vault. This operation requires the storage/list permission.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of storage accounts along with a link to the next page of storage accounts.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Restores a backed up storage account to a vault.
post.description: Restores a backed up storage account to a vault. This operation requires the storage/restore permission.

requestBody.description: The parameters to restore the storage account.

200.description: Restored storage account bundle in the vault.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about a specified storage account. This operation requires the storage/get permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

200.description: The retrieved storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a new storage account. This operation requires the storage/set permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

requestBody.description: The parameters to create a storage account.

200.description: The created storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a storage account. This operation requires the storage/delete permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

200.description: The deleted storage account and information on when the storage account will be deleted, and how to recover the deleted storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the specified attributes associated with the given storage account. This operation requires the storage/set/update permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

requestBody.description: The parameters to update a storage account.

200.description: The updated storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.summary: Backs up the specified storage account.
post.description: Requests that a backup of the specified storage account be downloaded to the client. This operation requires the storage/backup permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

200.description: The backup blob containing the backed up storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Regenerates the specified key value for the given storage account. This operation requires the storage/regeneratekey permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

requestBody.description: The parameters to regenerate storage account key.

200.description: The updated storage account.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List storage SAS definitions for the given storage account. This operation requires the storage/listsas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return in a page. If not specified the service will return up to 25 results.

200.description: A response message containing a list of SAS definitions along with a link to the next page of SAS definitions.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about a SAS definition for the specified storage account. This operation requires the storage/getsas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: sas-definition-name
parameters.description: The name of the SAS definition.

200.description: The retrieved SAS definition.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a new SAS definition for the specified storage account. This operation requires the storage/setsas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: sas-definition-name
parameters.description: The name of the SAS definition.

requestBody.description: The parameters to create a SAS definition.

200.description: The created SAS definition.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes a SAS definition from a specified storage account. This operation requires the storage/deletesas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: sas-definition-name
parameters.description: The name of the SAS definition.

200.description: The deleted SAS definition and information on when the SAS definition will be deleted, and how to recover the deleted SAS definition.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the specified attributes associated with the given SAS definition. This operation requires the storage/setsas permission.

parameters.name: storage-account-name
parameters.description: The name of the storage account.

parameters.name: sas-definition-name
parameters.description: The name of the SAS definition.

requestBody.description: The parameters to update a SAS definition.

200.description: The updated SAS definition.

default.description: Key Vault error response describing why the operation failed.

enabled.description: Determines whether the issuer is enabled.

IssuerAttributes.description: The attributes of an issuer managed by the Key Vault service.

IssuerBundle.description: The issuer for Key Vault certificate.

IssuerCredentials.description: The credentials to be used for the certificate issuer.

cert_transparency.description: Indicates if the certificates generated under this policy should be published to certificate transparency logs.

cty.description: Certificate type as supported by the provider (optional); for example 'OV-SSL', 'EV-SSL'

name.description: Name of the referenced issuer object or reserved names; for example, 'Self' or 'Unknown'.

IssuerParameters.description: Parameters for the issuer of the X509 component of a certificate.

crv.description: Elliptic curve name. For valid values, see JsonWebKeyCurveName.

d.description: RSA private exponent, or the D component of an EC private key.

key_hsm.description: HSM Token, used with 'Bring Your Own Key'.

kty.description: JsonWebKey Key Type (kty), as defined in https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-jose-json-web-algorithms-40.

q.description: RSA secret prime, with p < q.

x.description: X component of an EC public key.

y.description: Y component of an EC public key.

managed.description: True if the key's lifetime is managed by key vault. If this is a key backing a certificate, then managed will be true.

SubjectAlternativeNames.description: The subject alternate names of a X509 object.

days_before_expiry.description: Days before expiry to attempt renewal. Value should be between 1 and validity_in_months multiplied by 27. If validity_in_months is 36, then value should be between 1 and 972 (36 * 27).

lifetime_percentage.description: Percentage of lifetime at which to trigger. Value should be between 1 and 99.

Trigger.description: A condition to be satisfied for an action to be executed.

subject.description: The subject name. Should be a valid X509 distinguished Name.

validity_months.description: The duration that the certificate is valid in months.

X509CertificateProperties.description: Properties of the X509 component of a certificate.
